item.title: Network (Wi-Fi) gone after sleep or hibernation on Windows
item.dc:creator: m
item.description:
If your network (Wi-Fi) disappears after sleep or hibernation on Windows, try this out! 1. Open Device Manager by pressing Windows Key + X and Device Manager 2. Right-click on any device type and click Scan for hardware changes Your network should be restored now! If you’re having any issues, feel free to leave a […]

The post Network (Wi-Fi) gone after sleep or hibernation on Windows appeared first on myat hosting.
item.content:encoded:
If your network (Wi-Fi) disappears after sleep or hibernation on Windows, try this out!

1. Open Device Manager by pressing Windows Key + X and Device Manager

    2. Right-click on any device type and click Scan for hardware changes

    Your network should be restored now! If you’re having any issues, feel free to leave a comment Hope this helps

    The post Network (Wi-Fi) gone after sleep or hibernation on Windows appeared first on myat hosting.

Processor Apple M1 Apple M2 Pro Memory 8GB 16GB Storage 128GB SSD 512GB SSD Volume discount Yes No Pricing/day $5 $7 Pricing/week $30 $49 […]

The post Introducing cheap Mac mini hosting in the cloud appeared first on myat hosting.
item.content:encoded:
To expand our services and our customer base, we’re now introducing the Mac mini in our data centers, for as cheap as $5 daily. We have the following Macs for rent.

We also have Intel VMs running macOS Sequoia for long-term usage. It is much cheaper than the Mac minis and offer a great price to performance ratio for $35/month. (offering volume discounts as well)

The default OS is macOS Sequoia while the default OS for M2 Pro Macs are macOS Sonoma. You may request for a custom macOS version but it will extend delivery time by two hours.

If you have any inquiries or you’d like to subscribe, feel free to reach out to us at our contact page We’ll respond as fast as possible. Have a nice day ahead!

The post Introducing cheap Mac mini hosting in the cloud appeared first on myat hosting.

item.title: Error: Cannot find module ‘express’ – Netlify Functions
item.dc:creator: m
item.description:
This issue happens when youâ€™re using Netlify Functions and using a custom directory to store your functions.

The post Error: Cannot find module ‘express’ – Netlify Functions appeared first on myat hosting.
item.content:encoded:
This issue happens when youâ€™re using Netlify Functions and using a custom directory to store your functions.

Solution

Add this to your netlify.toml

[[plugins]]
  package = "@netlify/plugin-functions-install-core"

And add package.json to your custom directory

More information

In my case, this was my directory structure:

functions
â””â”€â”€ src
|    | index.ts
| pnpm-lock.yaml
| package.json
| netlify.toml 
| verify.ts

And my netlify.toml looked like this:

[functions]
  external_node_modules = ["express"]
  node_bundler = "esbuild"
  directory = "src"
[[redirects]]
  force = true
  from = "/*"
  status = 200
  to = "/.netlify/functions/index/:splat"

This was copy paste from the Netlify article about running Express.js on Netlify Functions, except I’m redirecting people to / instead of /api like what was in the article. I also added a custom directory to simplify my file structure.

However, I found out that I was getting invocation errors and I tried to deploy from the Netlify CLI instead. I got a different error now about some dependency, and I kept on adding those to my package.json. But that took forever and I got bored.

I tried to add my package.json into my custom directory (src) instead but got another error about how I need to use a plugin or put the package.json in the top level or something. So I added the plugin, placed back the package.json and it still didn’t work

# netlify.toml
[functions]
  external_node_modules = ["express"]
  node_bundler = "esbuild"
  directory = "src"
[[redirects]]
  force = true
  from = "/*"
  status = 200
  to = "/.netlify/functions/index/:splat"
[[plugins]]
  package = "@netlify/plugin-functions-install-core"

I added the package.json and the pnpm-lock.yaml (for luck) into both the top level directory and my src folder, only then did it deploy properly. 

functions
â””â”€â”€ src
|    | index.ts
|    | package.json
|    | pnpm-lock.yaml
| pnpm-lock.yaml
| package.json
| netlify.toml 
| verify.ts

Hope this helps you out!

The post Error: Cannot find module ‘express’ – Netlify Functions appeared first on myat hosting.
